body: @MrOrz i think all css stuff should be extracted
If returning the element itself from the provider, could the developer maybe use css to set wanted properties himself instead of doing it this way with the progressbarContainer.css()?
Oh yeah, it would be great if the element is available from inside the provider!
Since this moved into example/, it should be ../build/ngProgress.js, right?
This is possibly pointing at the wrong file as well.
I have a bad feeling about 'parent', because it will presumably pollute the global space. That is a general code issue that we have though....
The `parent` variable is limited to the scope of the function, however I can change its name if you see fit.
Oh you're right, I overlooked something! Alright then, thanks for the contribution!
This pr fixed the `bower.json`, but not `package.json`. With bower being replaced by npm for a lot of devs this is an issue with module resolution.
